abstract: At least 31 people in South Bronx are stricken with Legionnaires' Disease, which is commonly spread via water mist, and two people die; several apartment building cooling towers in area are found to contain bacteria.
lead_paragraph: The outbreak of the disease, the largest New York City has seen in at least two years, has flared up in the neighborhoods of Highbridge, Morrisania, Mott Haven and Hunts Point since July 10.

headline.main: Legionnaires’ Disease Sickens 31, 2 Fatally, in the South Bronx
headline.print_headline: Legionnaires’ Disease Kills 2 in the Bronx

snippet: The outbreak of the disease, the largest New York City has seen in at least two years, has flared up in the neighborhoods of Highbridge, Morrisania, Mott Haven and Hunts Point since July 10.
